identified-content.person: BENNETT, DR. CAROLYN MARIE (DR. CAROLYN MARIE CLARK)

block.p: Dr. Carolyn Marie Bennett and Martin John Clark were married yesterday by Msgr. Austin P. Bennett, a cousin of the bride, at the Cathedral Basilica of St. James in Brooklyn.

The bride, 36, is a fellow in pediatric hematology-oncology at the Children's Hospital and the Dana Farber Cancer Institute in Boston. She received a bachelor's degree in mathematics and economics from Fordham University and a medical degree from New York University. Dr. Bennett, who will continue to use her name professionally, is a daughter of Dr. Angela Bennett and John J. Bennett. Her father is a lawyer practicing in Manhattan. Her mother is a professor of pediatrics at State University Health Science Center at Brooklyn. The bride's grandfather the late John J. Bennett Jr. was New York State attorney general from 1930 to 1942.
Dr. Carolyn Marie Bennett and Martin John Clark were married yesterday by Msgr. Austin P. Bennett, a cousin of the bride, at the Cathedral Basilica of St. James in Brooklyn.

The bride, 36, is a fellow in pediatric hematology-oncology at the Children's Hospital and the Dana Farber Cancer Institute in Boston. She received a bachelor's degree in mathematics and economics from Fordham University and a medical degree from New York University. Dr. Bennett, who will continue to use her name professionally, is a daughter of Dr. Angela Bennett and John J. Bennett. Her father is a lawyer practicing in Manhattan. Her mother is a professor of pediatrics at State University Health Science Center at Brooklyn. The bride's grandfather the late John J. Bennett Jr. was New York State attorney general from 1930 to 1942.

Mr. Clark, 42, is the international director of Coerver Coaching, a London-based soccer education program. He is a son of Sidney Clark of Colchester, England, and the late Brenda Clark. His father, a retired maintenance worker, worked in hospitals around Colchester.
